docs.lead_paragraph: Wyeth Laboratories is recalling 1.7 million more cans and bottles of infant formula that is deficient in vitamin B6, an essential nutrient for babies, the Food and Drug Administration said today. The recall of the company's SMA product is in addition to a recall of more than 550,000 cans of the formula that Wyeth agreed to Thursday. Wyeth also recalled 50,000 cans of Nursoy soy-based formula on March 3 that was totally lacking in vitamin B6. An infant who does not receive enough vitamin B6, even for short periods, can suffer irritability, nausea and convulsions. A prolonged absence of the vitamin can cause permanent injury, including cerebral palsy and retardation.

headline.main: WYETH EXPANDS RECALL OF DEFECTIVE BABY FORMULA
